intro: Onychium tenuifrons, commonly known as the slender-fruited onychium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
